intro: Calophysa dispar, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Calophysa dispar is known for its milky sap, which is a characteristic feature of the Apocynaceae family. It typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
